name: Willpower
description: Willpower measures a character's inner drive and competence at overcoming unfavorable odds. Unlike other Traits, Willpower has both a permanent rating and a temporary pool of points. The rating is rolled or tested, while the pool is spent. A character's Willpower pool will likely fluctuate during the course of a story or chronicle. It decreases by one point every time a player uses a Willpower point to enable their character to do something extraordinary, like maintain self-control or gain an automatic success. Willpower points can be regained during the course of a story.

name: Gnosis
description: A character's blood pool measures how much vitae the vampire has in their system. Each blood point corresponds roughly to one-tenth of the blood in an average adult mortal. The maximum number of blood points a vampire may ingest is dictated by their Generation, as is the number of blood points they may spend in a single turn. A vampire with zero blood points in their system is ravenously hungry and likely in the throes of frenzy.

name: Rage
description: A Kindred's Humanity rating reflects how much of a character's mortal nature remains despite the curse of Caine. It influences how well a character may deny her vampiric state, as well as how effectively she may pass for mortal. Alternatively, Kindred may follow Paths of Enlightenment, abandoning mortal concerns and adopting inhuman codes to anchor themselves against the Beast.

name: Obligation
description: Obligation measures a character's commitment to a cause, a promise, or a duty. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to sacrifice for a cause, a promise, or a duty.

name: Obedience
description: Obedience indicates a character's willingness to follow orders or instructions. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to follow orders or instructions.

name: Ferocity
description: Ferocity measures a character's willingness to fight or defend themselves or others. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to fight or defend themselves or others.

name: Succor
description: Succor measures a character's willingness to help others. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to help others.

name: Cunning
description: Cunning measures a character's ability to deceive, manipulate, or outsmart others. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to deceive, manipulate, or outsmart others.
game_line: Ajaba, Ananasi, Bastet, Kitsune, Ratkin, Nuwisha

name: Glory
description: Glory measures a character's desire for recognition, fame, or glory.

name: Honor
description: Honor measures a character's sense of right and wrong. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to follow their sense of right and wrong.
game_line: Garou, Corax, Kitsune, Mokole, Bastet, Gurahl

name: Wisdom
description: Wisdom measures a character's ability to understand the world and make wise decisions. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to understand the world and make wise decisions.

name: Humor
description: Humor measures a character's ability to find humor in the world. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to find humor in the world.

name: Infamy
description: Infamy measures a character's notoriety or infamy. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to be known for their notoriety or infamy.

name: Valor
description: Valor measures a character's bravery or courage. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to be brave or courageous.

name: Harmony
description: Harmony measures a character's ability to work with others. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to work with others.

name: Innovation
description: Innovation measures a character's ability to think outside the box and come up with new ideas. It is a moral trait, and its rating is used to determine how much a character is willing to think outside the box and come up with new ideas.
